intro: Navarretia rubra, commonly known as the pink navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and slender stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or mountainous regions. Its blooming period occurs in early spring, producing delicate pink or white flowers that attract pollinators. Navarretia rubra is known for its rapid life cycle, often completing its growth and reproduction within a single growing season.
